p.codeblock: abstract switchSrc(src: string, syncPts?: boolean): number;
abstract switchSrc(src: string, syncPts?: boolean): number;
Future<void> switchSrc({required String src, bool syncPts = true});
public abstract int SwitchSrc(string src, bool syncPts = true);

section.p:
You can call this method to switch the bitrate of the media source being played based on the current network condition. For example:
When the network is poor, switch to a lower bitrate media source URL.
When the network is good, switch to a higher bitrate media source URL. After calling this method, if you receive the callback reporting the PlayerEventSwitchComplete event, the media source has been switched successfully. If the switch fails, the SDK automatically retries 3 times. If it still fails, you will receive the callback reporting the PlayerEventSwitchError event, indicating an error occurred during the media source switch.

You can call this method to switch the bitrate of the media resource being played based on the current network conditions. For example:
When the network is poor, switch to a lower bitrate media resource.
When the network is good, switch to a higher bitrate media resource. After calling this method, if you receive the callback with the event PlayerEventSwitchComplete, the switch is successful. If the switch fails, the SDK automatically retries 3 times. If it still fails, you will receive the callback with the event PlayerEventSwitchError, indicating an error occurred during the switch.

You can call this method to switch the bitrate of the media resource being played based on the current network conditions. For example:
When the network is poor, switch to a lower bitrate media resource.
When the network is good, switch to a higher bitrate media resource. After calling this method, if you receive the callback reporting the playerEventSwitchComplete event, the media resource has been switched successfully. If the switch fails, the SDK retries 3 times. If it still fails, you receive the callback reporting the playerEventSwitchError event, indicating an error occurred during the switch.

You can call this method to switch the bitrate of the currently playing media resource based on the network conditions. For example:
When the network is poor, switch to a lower bitrate media resource.
When the network is good, switch to a higher bitrate media resource. After calling this method, if you receive the callback reporting the event PLAYER_EVENT_SWITCH_COMPLETE, the switch was successful. If the switch fails, the SDK retries 3 times. If it still fails, you receive the callback reporting the PLAYER_EVENT_SWITCH_ERROR event, indicating an error occurred during the switch.

ul.li: Make sure to call this method after .

To ensure normal playback, pay attention to the following when calling this method:
Do not call this method while playback is paused.
Do not call during bitrate switching.
Ensure the playback position before switching is not greater than the total duration of the target media source.
Make sure to call this method after .

To ensure normal playback, note the following when calling this method:
Do not call this method while playback is paused.
Do not call during bitrate switching.
Ensure the playback position before switching is not greater than the total duration of the target media resource.
Make sure to call this method after .

To ensure normal playback, note the following when calling this method:
Do not call this method while playback is paused.
Do not call during bitrate switching.
Ensure the playback position before switching does not exceed the total duration of the media resource to be switched.
Make sure to call this method after .

To ensure normal playback, pay attention to the following when calling this method:
Do not call this method while playback is paused.
Do not call during bitrate switching.
Ensure the playback position before switching is not greater than the total duration of the media resource being switched to.

plentry.pd: The network path of the media source.

Whether to synchronize the starting playback position before and after the switch:
: Synchronize.
: (Default) Do not synchronize.
The network path of the media resource.

Whether to synchronize the starting playback position before and after the switch:
: Synchronize.
: (Default) Do not synchronize.
Network path of the media resource.

Whether to synchronize the start playback position before and after switching:
: Synchronize.
: (Default) Do not synchronize.
The network path of the media resource.

Whether to synchronize the start playback position before and after switching:
: Synchronize.
: (Default) Do not synchronize.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
